intro: Impatiens eravikulamensis, commonly known as the Eravikulam impatiens, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is characterized by its vibrant red flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories, thriving in humid and cool environments. It is a member of the Balsaminaceae family, known for its showy and often colorful blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
